original_body:
This post is part of our special coverage of Bahrain Protests 2011. Bahrain's Day of Wrath protests are continuing for the second day. Two protesters have been killed, reportedly at the hands of police using excessive force. Here are some of the reactions from Twitter on the day:
@alibinkhalid: “@mkalkhalifa: Impressive BTV ... Finally a live feed ... welcome to the 21st century” exactly!
@JustAmira: Bahrain TV showing Pearl roundabout protesters LIVE #feb14 http://yfrog.com/h288kwoj
@JustAmira: Now that BTV has shown the Pearl roundabout protests, can they show the videos which horrified us on national TV as well? #Feb14 #Bahrain
@Ali_Fareed: BTV is hosting a live discussion about current protests btw. Some good improvement on their programming #Bahrain #Feb14
@chanadbh: Journalist just mentioned protests in Bahrain in a question to Pres Obama in press conf! #Feb14
@iLandBahrain: MOI spokesman on #Bahrain TV says two deaths r accidents to be investigated. Actually he sounded more reasonable than the other BTV guests
@YousefMunayyer: #Bahrain TV panel: Sure the people have concerns, but the legitimacy of the regime can not be one of them. #feb14
@monaeltahawy: We're following 4 uprisings at once: keep an eye on hashtags! #Algeria #Bahrain also #Feb14 #Yemen #Iran also #25Bahman
@MZ5aaan: A Bird View of Pearl Round about Protest #Bahrain #feb14 http://twitpic.com/404m09
@emile_hokayem: Went on tour of Manama Sanabis Budeiya etc. Massive n aggressive-looking police deployments. Police shd be abt reassurance not intimidation
@ian_black: WikiLeaks cables show no evidence of Iran's hand in Bahrain unrest http://gu.com/p/2n5nh/tf
@bintbattuta: I hope this means that no one asks me where #Bahrain is again. #feb14
@nezarradhi: #Bahrain is trending on Twitter Canada!
@mohdalwardi: #Bahrain #Feb14 بدون تعليق! | No Comment! http://plixi.com/p/77618454
@reemkhalifa17: Pearl sq became Bahrain Tahrir sq.Bahrain started a revolution and now they set up tents,etc.Bahraini will sleep in th sq #Bahrain #Feb14
@angryarabiya: They've brought matresses for the protesters #bahrain #feb14
@SayedMohDarwish: Going to Lulu roundabout -- having dinner with my wife #Bahrain #Feb14
@maryamalkhawaja: Just finished interview with #aljazeera and #channel4 london. Ppl are giving out food, setting up tents, and cleaning #lulu #feb14 #bahrain
@Yousef_Slais: The Demands are not Clear, Please Clear them for All if You Want More To Join #feb14 #bahrain #luluroundabout
@SaraMahmood8: Ebrahim shareef in his speech:"we should all be united under similar chants and demands" #lulu #bahrain #feb14
@RamiJamal: Those who want to and demand a general strike I request you to use common sense. #Bahrain #Feb14 #LuluRoundabout
This post is part of our special coverage of Bahrain Protests 2011.
title: Bahrain: Day of Wrath Number Two

sentence: This post is part of our special coverage of Bahrain Protests 2011.
Bahrain's Day of Wrath protests are continuing for the second day.
Two protesters have been killed, reportedly at the hands of police using excessive force.

Here are some of the reactions from Twitter on the day:
 @alibinkhalid: “@mkalkhalifa: Impressive BTV ... Finally a live feed ... welcome to the 21st century” exactly!

Actually he sounded more reasonable than the other BTV guests

Police shd be abt reassurance not intimidation
